name: Branes N. SOUTHARD and Deborah Southard, Husband and Wife, Respondents, v. TEMPLE UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL, David H. Clements, III, M.D., and William F. Young, M.D., Petitioners. (Petition of David H. Clements, III, M.D., and William F. Young, M.D.)

parties: Branes N. SOUTHARD and Deborah Southard, Husband and Wife, Respondents, v. TEMPLE UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL, David H. Clements, III, M.D., and William F. Young, M.D., Petitioners. (Petition of David H. Clements, III, M.D., and William F. Young, M.D.).

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
AND NOW, this 26th day of July, 2000, allowance of appeal is GRANTED, limited to the first issue presented in the above-captioned Petition for Allowance of Appeal.
Furthermore, Petitioners’ Motion for Leave to Submit Memorandum of Supplemental Authorities is DENIED.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

casebody.head_matter:
756 A.2d 670
Branes N. SOUTHARD and Deborah Southard, Husband and Wife, Respondents, v. TEMPLE UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL, David H. Clements, III, M.D., and William F. Young, M.D., Petitioners. (Petition of David H. Clements, III, M.D., and William F. Young, M.D.).
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
July 26, 2000.
